image.title: Currently Hospitalized: CTP & HHS Best Match Values (1-Day Offset), Sep 1 - Nov 29
image.description: Line chart showing hospitalization data from state (CTP) and from HHS. When the correct definitions are used, and the HHS data offset by a single day, the two lines match almost exactly.

Some states report data that match best with confirmed COVID hospitalizations only while others match best with confirmed and suspected hospitalizations summed together.

image.title: New Daily Cases (CTP Data) & New Admissions (HHS Data) and Correlation Trends between New Admissions & New Cases, Oct - Nov 2020
image.description: On left, a line chart comparing the national aggregate (7-day rolling average) of new COVID cases per day (CTP data) against new hospital admissions for COVID patients per day (HHS data). On right, a time lagged cross correlation study shows that the trend of new admissions best fits that of new cases when lagging by one day nationally.

lede.lede: Despite a rocky beginning, the current hospitalization and new admissions metrics from the HHS Protect public dataset have stabilized—and they’re now largely harmonious with state-reported hospitalization metrics if we account for differences in data definitions and reporting lag time.
